# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt, bump=3)
    if typeof(dt) !== "DateTime"
        throw ArgumentError("Input must be of type DateTime.")
    end

    bumped_dt = dt + hours(bump)
    return bumped_dt
end
```

Now, you can use the `timezone_bumper` function to bump a DateTime and it will only work with DateTime types. If you try to input a Date, an error will be thrown.
